quotes.quote: The thrill of coming home has never changed.
It's nice to have some continuity you can come back to. I feel that in coming home, coming back to London.
This is my idea of heaven, coming home and watching the news.
Coming home to my family afterward makes the work richer, easier and more fun.
I am travelling half the year around the world, every year, so coming home is one of the most beautiful things.
There's just no place like Scotland when the sun is out. I just love coming home.
There's nothing like coming home here, having the day off or morning off and going surfing. In Orlando I don't know what I would do.
The thing about coming back to the Bay Area, it's like coming home for me.
There's been a lot of coming home in the early mornings after funny nights out, having bizarre sandwiches in bed.
There's nothing half so pleasant as coming home again.
It's a funny thing coming home. Nothing changes. Everything looks the same, feels the same, even smells the same. You realize what's changed, is you.
I love coming home, especially with a victory.
It has been a long time. I am so glad to be coming back home.
Maybe that's the best part of going away for a vacation-coming home again.
Coming home seemed to have started the healing process. No longer vivid and garish, the memories seemed to be covered in gossemer, fading behind a curtain of time and forgiveness.
He was very, very excited about the idea of coming home and being with his wife and the baby.
It's great he's coming home.
I love coming home to my own home and husband and everything we have.
It is dismal coming home, when there is nobody to welcome one!
Coming home from very lonely places, all of us go a little mad: whether from great personal success, or just an all-night drive, we are the sole survivors of a world no one else has ever seen.
Just keep coming home to yourself, you are the one who you've been waiting for.
It's very important to know that we packed it right because it is a safety issue for coming home.
Coming into the place of Soul-awareness is coming home.
Going home must be like going to render an account.
Going home and spending time with your family and your real friends keeps you grounded.
The prospect of going home is very appealing.
Not going home is already like death.
It feels great to be home, great to be back as a part of the community.
I love coming home to somebody, I love being in a relationship.
I try to make my bed every day for mental health. Coming home to an unmade bed or a room with clothes all over will depress me.
I kind of love coming home and being with family and feeling comfortable and knowing where I come from; I kind of like it.
For me, going to London is like coming home. In fact, I've often entertained the idea of ending my days there.
When you live on the road, going home is a place to escape and just be with your family to unwind.
I'm happy going home early and working out and just being a mother and being a wife.
I've had a splendid time and I feel that it marks an epoch in my life. But the best of it all was the coming home.
When you've found the right one - when you see him, when you're with him - you'll feel like you're coming home.
Any time that we have time to take off, we love being home.
There is nothing like staying at home for real comfort.
Seek home for rest, for home is best.
You never know what events are going to transpire to get you home.
When I go home, its an easy way to be grounded. You learn to realize what truly matters.
A man travels the world over in search of what he needs and returns home to find it.
You leave home to seek your fortune and, when you get it, you go home and share it with your family.
My only concern was to get home after a hard day's work.
We have invented a new human right here - the right to return home after a war.
Men dream more about coming home than about leaving.
There are a thousand ways to kneel and kiss the ground; there are a thousand ways to go home again.
But there is room now in my heart for more memories, carved by a letting go that I could find only by coming home to a place I'd never been.
It's risky in a marriage for a man to come home too late, but it can sometimes pose an even greater risk if he comes home too early.
I always feel that when I come to Edinburgh, in many ways I am coming home.
I don't know anybody who has so many places to go home to .
At every party, there are two kinds of people — those who want to go home and those who don't. The trouble is, they are usually married to each other
Home is where you come to when you have nothing better to do.
What's the good of a home if you're never in it.

Now, at last, this sad, glittering century has an image worthy of it; a wandering, wondering girl, a silly Sloane turned secular saint, coming home in her coffin to RAF Northolt like the good soldier she was.
Husband can't understand why wife ever complains about anything when she has his coming home in the evening to look forward to.
One road leads home and a thousand roads lead into the wilderness.

Historically, many immigrants, refugees, and exiles have been unable to return home. Yet, surprisingly in recent times, many people find they can return home again and they are doing so— to visit, to live temporarily, or to re establish a long term residence.
Throughout the world, immigrants and refugees are choosing to go home again and expanding their own resources to re-establish themselves in a former home even after having left many years earlier.

I'm coming home, I'm coming home / Tell the world I'm coming home / Let the rain wash away / All the pain of yesterday / I know my kingdom awaits / And they've forgiven my mistakes / I'm coming home, I'm coming home / Tell the world that I'm coming.
Now I'm feeling something (yes I am) / Where I was missing something (yes I am) / I love coming home to you, baby / You know I'm coming home to you.
It's a long and lonely highway. / When you're traveling all alone. / I was on my way to nowhere. / But now I'm coming home. / I'm coming home.
I'm in the sky tonight / There I can keep by your side / Watching the wide world riot and hiding out / I'll be coming home next year.

Oh, it's home again, and home again, America for me! / Our hearts are turning home again and there we long to be, / In our beautiful big country beyond the ocean bars, / Where the air is full of sunlight and the flag is full of stars.
And so it seems like welcoming a friend-- / An old, old friend, upon his coming home / From some far country--coming home to spend / Long, loitering days with me.
Oh, it is good afar to roam, / And seek adventure in strange lands; / Yet oh, so good the coming home, / The velvet love of little hands.

I have always liked coming home and sharing what has happened that day with my loved ones. I like comparing notes. I know other people do, too. I think there is a human instinct to tell stories, no matter who you are or where you live.
I love coming home, sleeping in my own bed, seeing my own family and friends again. It feels like a big comfort for me.
Coming home to my family afterward makes the work richer, easier, and more fun.
Now I see that the journey was never meant to lead to some new and improved version of me; that it has always been about coming home to who I already am.
When you finally go back to your old home, you find it wasn't the old home you missed but your childhood.

Well, it was a million tiny little things that, when you added them all up, they meant we were supposed to be together... and I knew it. I knew it the very first time I touched her. It was like coming home... only to no home, I'd ever known... I was just taking her hand to help her out of a car and I knew. It was like... magic.
It’s a funny thing coming home. Nothing changes. Everything looks the same, feels the same, even smells the same. You realized what’s changed is you.
I hate leaving home. I love what I do, but I'd love to go home every night.
Let the wife make the husband glad to come home, and let him make her sorry to see him leave.
No matter who you are or where you are, instinct tells you to go home.
I believe that all of our lives we're looking for home and if we're really lucky, we find it in someone’s loving arms. I think that’s what life is – coming home.
